description:
Here's your friendly reminder that there is fluoride, chlorine, PFAS & pharmaceuticals in your water supply--⁣
⁣
petrochemicals, neurotoxic, immunotoxic and carcinogenic pesticides, artificial colorants, additives, emulsifiers, flavors & excitotoxins in your food--⁣
⁣
respiratory irritants & cancerous industrial pollutants in your air--⁣
⁣
phthlates & endocrine disrupters in your personal care products--⁣
⁣
and bioaccumulative xenobiotics in your upholstery, wardrobe, furniture, carpet, mattresses, Teflon coated pans, & just about everything else,⁣
⁣
that tobacco products are legal despite killing 8 million per year and totaling $300 billion in economic cost--⁣
⁣
yet we are supposed to believe the government that allows all of this suddenly cares about your health and well-being.⁣
⁣
--⁣
⁣
FOOD FOR THOUGHT: Lifestyle-related diseases kill 41 million people each year, equivalent to 71% of all deaths globally, without even a fraction of the outcry that we are now experiencing--without mandates, legislation, or global discussion on prevention--without sweeping government overreach into the daily activities & habits of its citizenry. ⁣
⁣
What message does it send, what agenda is afloat, when partaking in the mainstays of sound health--community, nature, exercise, & oxygen consumption are discouraged or made punishable-- while fast food & liquor stores remain open?⁣
⁣
When cornerstones of health like gyms and beaches are closed, playgrounds are vanquished with police tape, & in California, surfers are arrested & people are heavily fined for watching the sunset?⁣
⁣
Why restrict unencumbered access to fresh air and nature, which is itself is a repository of beneficial bacteria, viruses, bacteriophages, & fungi that inoculate & nourish our microbiome--& in turn, favorably modulate our immune systems?⁣
⁣
Why limit immunoprotective vitamin D and instead actively encourage consumption of refined sugar, trans fats, rancid vegetable oils, & factory farmed meat?⁣
⁣
Why severely limit social contact when the odds of mortality due to social isolation & loneliness have been shown to be similar to smoking 15 cigarettes/day?⁣
⁣
Is this really, truly, solely about health?⁣
⁣
